column2: ALABAMA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Alabama
column6: AL

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. A yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:
column4: Drivers are not required to signal before turning from that lane.
column6: Be prepared to stop and give the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles.
column8: Increase your speed to make the turn before the light changes.

column2: 2. If you encounter an aggressive driver you should:
column4: show them how to drive defensively.
column6: speed up.

column2: 3. When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
column4: come to a complete stop, then proceed.
column6: slow and proceed with caution.

column2: 4. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: signal.

column2: 5. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Try to move away safely.
column6: Remain calm and relaxed.

column2: 6. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: signal your intention before changing lanes.
column6: check your blind spots and, mirrors.

column2: 7. This sign indicates that:
column4: there is a steep hill ahead.
column6: trucks are merging from the right

column2: 8. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: After the crosswalk.
column6: Before the stop line.

column2: 9. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column6: Get enough sleep.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 11. To keep the driver behind you at a safe distance you should:
column4: keep a steady speed.
column6: drive 5 MPH faster than the car behind.
column8: drive 5 MPH slower than the car behind.

column2: 12. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: the law.
column6: what is not allowed.

column2: 13. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: green; white
column6: blue; white

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down, slippery when wet
column6: Detour ahead

column2: 15. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 16. To avoid hydroplaning you should:
column4: keep your tires properly inflated.
column6: slow down when roads are wet.

column2: 17. It is legal to make a left turn at a red light after stopping if:
column4: you are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.
column6: you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
column8: you yield to all other traffic at the intersection before proceeding.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Road construction ahead
column6: The road ahead curves right, then left

column2: 19. Signs that indicate a No Passing Zone tell drivers that:
column4: it is not safe to pass.
column6: passing is only permitted in daylight hours.
column8: not passing other vehicles is prohibited.

column2: 20. If you miss your exit on a freeway, do NOT:
column4: continue on the freeway and find an alternative route.
column6: turn around or back up.
column8: get back on the freeway in the opposite direction and return to the exit you want.

column2: 21. When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
column4: help the pedestrian cross the street.
column6: yield the right of way at corners only.

column2: 22. When entering an interstate highway, you should check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match the flow of traffic, signal and:
column4: wait for the lane to be clear.
column6: merge into that gap when safe.

column2: 23. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: accelerate much faster
column6: stop much more quickly

column2: 24. To avoid panic stops, you should:
column4: scan the road ahead for hazards.
column6: drive with your window down.
column8: pump your brakes to make sure they work.

column2: 25. This sign is a warning that you are approaching:
column4: a railroad crossing.
column6: a crosswalk.

column2: 26. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Construction warning.
column6: Railroad crossing.

column2: 27. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column6: apply the brakes firmly.

column2: 28. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column4: Roundabout ahead.
column6: 270 degree turn ahead.

column2: 30. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 31. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.

column2: 32. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 33. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column6: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column8: honk your horn and proceed with caution.

column2: 34. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Honk your horn.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 35. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column6: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column8: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 36. If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is traveling in the area where you are driving, you must:
column4: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column6: proceed slowly and let the vehicle pass.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: Be prepared to stop if necessary
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column8: Stop and yield to pedestrians and cross traffic

column2: 38. If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
column4: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.
column6: proceed because you have the right-of-way.
column8: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.

column2: 39. Roads are most slippery:
column4: just before it rains.
column6: when it stops raining.
column8: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 40. A crosswalk is:
column4: a special type of 4-way intersection.
column6: an area designated for blind persons.
column8: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.
